item.title: [INDRAIND] Bluegod Entertainment Ltd. Approves Rights Issue of 10,54,24,650 Shares at Rs. 3.00 Each
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

The Board of Directors of Bluegod Entertainment Limited, at their meeting held on 28th February, 2026, approved the terms of a Rights Issue. The company will issue 10,54,24,650 fully paid-up equity shares at a price of Rs. 3.00 each, which includes a securities premium of Rs. 2.00 per equity share, amounting to a total issue size of Rs. 31,62,73,950. The record date for the Rights Issue is 6th March, 2026, and the Rights Issue period is from 12th March, 2026 to 19th March, 2026. The company has also executed a Term Sheet with Absolute Legends Sports Private Limited for the transfer of Intellectual Property Rights related to Legends League Cricket. However, the company has decided not to proceed with the acquisition or operation of any team in the Legends Cricket League at this stage.

  • Bluegod Entertainment Ltd. approves Rights Issue of 10,54,24,650 shares at Rs. 3.00 each
  • Issue price includes a securities premium of Rs. 2.00 per equity share
  • Record date set as 6th March, 2026
  • Rights Issue period from 12th March, 2026 to 19th March, 2026
  • Company executes Term Sheet with Absolute Legends Sports Private Limited for transfer of Intellectual Property Rights related to Legends League Cricket

item.title: [SHILINDORE] Sayaji Hotels (Indore) Ltd: Operational Creditor Seeks Withdrawal of Insolvency Petition
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Sayaji Hotels (Indore) Ltd has received an application from Ujaas Energy Limited, an operational creditor, for the withdrawal of a petition filed under Section 9 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016. The petition was initially filed before the Hon'ble National Company Law Tribunal, Indore Bench. The application for withdrawal was filed on February 27, 2026, under Rule 8 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy (Application to Adjudicating Authority) Rules, 2016, and Rule 11 of the NCLT Rules, 2016. The order for withdrawal and dismissal of the petition is awaited. The company will keep the Bombay Stock Exchange informed about the outcome of the application and any further material developments.

  • Ujaas Energy Limited, an operational creditor, has applied for the withdrawal of a petition filed against Sayaji Hotels (Indore) Ltd.
  • The petition was filed under Section 9 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016.

item.title: [NLCINDIA] NLC India Ltd Fined Rs. 5,42,800 by BSE for Non-Compliance with SEBI Regulations
item.description:
NLC India Ltd has received a notice from BSE Limited for non-compliance with the provisions of Regulation 17(1) of SEBI (LODR) Regulations, 2015, specifically for failing to appoint a Women Director. The BSE has imposed a fine of Rs. 5,42,800 each for this non-compliance. The Company has requested BSE to waive these fines, stating that the power to appoint Directors on the Board of Directors of the Company vests with the President of India and the non-compliance was not attributable to any negligence or default on the part of the Company. The fines have no impact on the operations or other activities of the Company, and the total financial implication is limited to the fines imposed by BSE.

  • NLC India Ltd fined Rs. 5,42,800 by BSE for non-compliance with SEBI regulations
  • Non-compliance pertains to the failure to appoint a Women Director
  • Company has requested BSE to waive the fines
  • The fines are not attributable to any negligence or default on the part of the Company
  • The fines have no impact on the operations or other activities of the Company

item.title: [NMSRESRC] NMS Global Ltd's EGM: Preferential Issue of Convertible Equity Warrants & Director Appointments Approved
item.description:

NMS Global Ltd held an Extraordinary General Meeting (EGM) on February 28, 2026, through video conferencing. The meeting, initially scheduled for 11:00 AM, started at 11:15 AM due to a technical glitch and concluded at 11:45 AM. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Pankaj Chander, and 43 shareholders attended via video conferencing. The meeting was held to discuss and approve the following items: 1. Issue of Convertible Equity Warrants on a preferential basis to non-promoters for cash consideration, 2. Appointment of Ms. Meenakshi Gupta as a Non Independent Non Executive Director, and 3. Increase in Authorised Share Capital of the Company and consequent alteration of Capital Clause of Memorandum of Association of the Company. The results of the voting on these resolutions, along with the Scrutinizerâ€™s Report, were intimated to the BSE, Metropolitan Stock Exchange of India Limited, the Registrar of Companies, NCT of Delhi & Haryana, and were placed on the Companyâ€™s website and on the website of Central Depository Services (India) Limited within 2 working days of the EGM.

item.title: [SHARDFI] Eco Hotels And Resorts: Reminder for Payment of First Call Money on Partly Paid-Up Equity Shares
item.description:
Eco Hotels And Resorts Ltd has issued a reminder for payment of First Call Money on partly paid-up equity shares. This reminder is for the outstanding 40,08,641 partly paid-up equity shares of the Company which were allotted on September 26, 2025. The First Call amount is Rs. 3.80 per partly paid-up equity share, comprising Rs.2.50 towards face value and Rs. 1.30 towards securities premium. The Reminder Notice for payment of first call will be sent to the holders of such partly paid-up equity shares on which the First Call money remains unpaid. The period for payment of the first call money pursuant to the Reminder Notice for payment of first call is from Thursday, 19% March, 2026 up to Thursday, 0274 April, 2026 (both days inclusive).

item.title: [INDRAIND] Bluegod Entertainment Ltd Fixes Record Date for Rights Issue Entitlements
item.description:
Bluegod Entertainment Ltd has announced Friday, 06 March, 2026 as the record date for the purpose of determining the equity shareholders who shall be entitled to receive the Rights Entitlement in the Rights Issue. The company has made necessary arrangements with NSDL and CDSL for the credits of the Rights Entitlements in dematerialized form in the demat account of the eligible equity shareholders as on the Record Date.
